text: The arrondissement of Dole is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Jura département in the Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region. Its capital, and subprefecture of the department, is the city of Dole. ==History== When the arrondissements of Jura were created in 1800, Dole was one of them in the Jura department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Dole is in the most northern of the arrondissements of the Jura department; it has an area of . It has a population of 83,701 inhabitants and a population density of inhabitants/km². The arrondissement of Dole is bordered to the north by the Haute-Saône department, to the east by Doubs department, to the south by the arrondissement Lons-le-Saunier, to the southwest by the Saône-et-Loire department and to the west by the Côte-d'Or department. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Dole, there are five cantons and they have all their "communes" in the arrondissement: # Authume (3902) # Dole-1 (3905) # Dole-2 (3906) # Mont-sous-Vaudrey (3910) # Tavaux (3917) ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Dole has 191 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes): #
